description.small: Bread is a staple food prepared from a dough of flour and water.
description.main: Bread may be leavened by naturally occurring microbes, chemicals, industrially produced yeast, or high-pressure aeration. In many countries, commercial bread often contains additives to improve flavor, texture, color, shelf life, nutrition, and ease of production.
description.origins: Rye bread contains phenolic acids and ferulic acid dehydrodimers.
description.howToCook: Bread is the staple food of the Middle East, Central Asia, North Africa, Europe, and in European-derived cultures such as those in the Americas, Australia, and Southern Africa. This is in contrast to parts of South and East Asia.

questions.author: Makiavelli
questions.body: How best to stir the flour?

description.small: The onion, also known as the bulb onion or common onion.
description.main: Onion is a vegetable that is the most widely cultivated species of the genus Allium. Its close relatives include the garlic, scallion, shallot, leek.
description.origins: Onions are cultivated and used around the world. As a food item, they are usually served cooked, as a vegetable or part of a prepared savoury dish.
description.howToCook: Onion they are usually served cooked, as a vegetable or part of a prepared savoury dish, but can also be eaten raw or used to make pickles or chutneys.

description.main: Garlic is a species in the onion genus, Allium.
description.origins: China produces some 80% of the world's supply of garlic.
description.howToCook: Garlic is a fundamental component in many or most dishes of various regions, including eastern Asia, South Asia, Southeast Asia, the Middle East, northern Africa

reviews.author: Franchesko Beluchi
reviews.body: One garlic will restore your acid-base balance.

questions.author: Anonimous
questions.body: Can i mix it with milk?
